intro: Gnoteris villosa, commonly known as the hairy gnoteris, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive, somewhat fern-like appearance. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow and bloom in early spring.
